concise_definition: n. 荣誉, 奖项, 优等学位

definitions.explanation_en: High respect or admiration earned by someone for their achievements, character, or service, often publicly recognized.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因个人的成就、品格或服务而赢得的崇高尊重或钦佩，通常由公众或机构正式认可。
definitions.example_en: She received honours for her groundbreaking work in renewable energy.
definitions.example_cn: 她因在可再生能源领域的开创性工作而荣获殊荣。

definitions.explanation_en: An academic distinction awarded to students who achieve a high level of performance in their degree program, especially in British and Commonwealth education systems.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在英国及英联邦教育体系中，授予在学位课程中表现优异学生的学术荣誉等级，如一等荣誉、二等一等荣誉等。
definitions.example_en: He graduated with first-class honours in Physics.
definitions.example_cn: 他以物理学一等荣誉学位毕业。

definitions.explanation_en: A formal ceremony, award, or title conferred to recognize outstanding contributions or service, often by a government or institution.
definitions.explanation_cn: 由政府或机构授予，以表彰杰出贡献或服务的正式仪式、奖项或头衔，如勋章、爵位等。
definitions.example_en: The Queen awarded him the honour of Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire.
definitions.example_cn: 女王授予他大英帝国骑士指挥官勋章。

comparison.analysis: “Award”（奖项）指具体的、通常有形的奖励，如奖杯、奖金或证书，强调授予行为本身；而 “honours” 更侧重于荣誉的性质和地位，可以是无形的尊重或学术等级，不一定伴随实物。
“Prize”（奖品）通常指竞赛或比赛中赢得的物质奖励，具有竞争性和唯一性；而 “honours” 更广泛，可基于长期贡献或学术表现授予，不一定是通过比赛获得，且更强调社会认可与尊严。
“Recognition”（认可）是一个更宽泛的词，泛指任何形式的注意或承认，可能是口头的、非正式的；而 “honours” 是一种制度化、正式化、通常具有等级或头衔性质的认可，承载更高的社会或学术分量。
